title: Earliest archaeological evidence of the existence of Piast strongholds in Greater Poland

title: Kazimierz I with the help of the emperor regains control over Greater Poland and Lesser Poland. Cracow becomes the capital of the monarchy

note: and Hungary (1060, 1063) by Bolesław II. The Polish ruler supports the anti-imperial opposition. Pomerania gains independence from Poland.
title: A series of wars and interventions in Kievan Rus
Zbigniew and Bolesław III decide to rule together. 1105–06 Bolesław III fights with Bohemian forces and establishes a close alliance with Kievan Rus’ and Koloman, king of Hungary

container-title: Zbigniew seeks help from Bohemia and Emperor Henry V
title: Bolesław accuses Zbigniew of supporting Bohemian intervention in Polish affairs and supporting an alliance with the Pomeranians. Bolesław forces Zbigniew into exile

Władysław II the Exile is the suzerain (princeps) of Poland
Civil war between Władysław II and his half-brothers, the Piast Juniors. Władysław is deposed and exiled
Bolesław IV the Curly is the suzerain (princeps) of Poland
